column5: Yup, very interesting, thanks!! Heard some where that an asian carp was caught or netted in Lake Ontario. Any truth to that?
I think the MNR found a grass carp near the mouth of the Don river a few years ago.  I also vaguely remember reading something about them catching another grass carp out of Grenadier pond.
I thought I heard something here about them being in the Kawarthas.

There are carp in the Kawarthas...Just not those particular species (silver, grass, bighead).  The carp that live (or more recently just died) in the Kawarthas are common carp with a few mirror carp mixed in.
I saw the video last week, very interesting indeed.   Here is part 2:
